sen.j: トロッコ保津峡駅（トロッコほづきょうえき）は、京都府京都市西京区嵐山北松尾山にある、嵯峨野観光鉄道嵯峨野観光鉄道嵯峨野観光線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Arashiyama Kita Matsuoyama, Nishikyo Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Hozukyo Torokko Station is a stop on the Saga Sight-Seeing Tram Line of Sagano Scenic Railway.
Hozukyo Torokko Station, located in Arashiyama Kita Matsuoyama, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Saga Sightseeing Tram Line of Sagano Scenic Railway.
Hozukyo Torokko Station, located in Arashiyama Kita Matsuoyama, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Saga Sightseeing Tram Line of Sagano Scenic Railway.

sen.j: 第2回近畿の駅百選選定駅である。
sen.e: The station was selected in the second event for a selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
The station was chosen as part of the second selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
The station was chosen as part of the second selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.

sen.j: 単式プラットホーム1面1線の駅。
sen.e: The station is provided with a single platform serving a track.
The station is provided with a single platform serving a track.
The station is provided with a single platform serving a track.

sen.j: 山陰本線時代は相対式ホーム2面2線であり、随所にその跡が残されている。
sen.e: When operated on San'in Main Line, the station was provided with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them, and therefore, their vestiges are found in various portions of the station.
When operated on the San'in Main Line, the station was provided with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them, and remnants thereof are found in various portions of the station.
When operated on the Sanin Main Line, the station was provided with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them, and remnants thereof are found in various portions of the station.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを削除し、sanin としました。

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道：山陰本線（嵯峨野線）保津峡駅
sen.e: West Japan Railway Company (JR West): Hozukyo Station on San'in Main Line (Sagano Line)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West): Hozukyo Station on the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West): Hozukyo Station on the Sanin Main Line (Sagano Line)
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを削除し、sanin としました。

sen.j: ※本駅と保津峡駅間は直線距離で約500mで、そのルートは保守用の通路で結ばれているが一般人の通行は禁止されている。
sen.e: * A passage for maintenance is provided between this station and Hozukyo Station, approx. 500 meters in a straight line, but is not usable by the general public.
* A passage for maintenance is provided between this station and Hozukyo Station, approximately 500 meters in a straight line, but it isn't usable by the general public.
A passage for maintenance is provided between this station and Hozukyo Station, approximately 500 meters in a straight line, but it isn't usable by the general public.

sen.j: 一般人が歩くことができる道路は水尾川の谷を迂回しているため約1100m離れている。
sen.e: The route along which the general public can walk is provided around a valley of Mizuo-gawa River, making the effective distance approx. 1100 meters for them.
The route along which the general public can walk is provided around a valley of the Mizuo-gawa River, by which the distance is approximately 1,100 meters.
The route along which the general public can walk is provided around a valley of the Mizuo-gawa River, by which the distance is approximately 1,100 meters.

sen.j: 連絡交通機関はなく徒歩で約15分の連絡となる。
sen.e: With no means of transportation available between the two stations, it takes about 15 minutes on foot to reach one of the two stations from the other.
With no means of transportation available between the two stations, it takes about 15 minutes on foot to reach one station from the other.
With no means of transportation available between the two stations, it takes about 15 minutes on foot to reach one station from the other.

sen.j: 1929年8月17日 - 山陰本線・松尾山信号場として開設。
sen.e: Initially it was established on Ausust 17, 1929, as the Matsuoyama signal station on the San'in Main Line
Initially, it was established on Ausust 17, 1929, as the Matsuoyama signal station on the San'in Main Line.
August 17, 1929: Initially, it was established as the Matsuoyama signal station on the Sanin Main Line.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを削除し、sanin としました。日付表記変更スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 1936年4月15日 - 旅客駅化し、保津峡駅として開業。
sen.e: On April 15, 1936, it started operations for passaengers with the name of Hozukyo Station.
On April 15, 1936, it started operations for passengers under the name of Hozukyo Station.
April 15, 1936: It started operations for passengers under the name of Hozukyo Station.

sen.j: 1987年4月1日 - 日本国有鉄道民営化により、西日本旅客鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: When Japan [Japanese] National Railways (JNR) was privatized on April 1, 1987, it becacme a station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
When Japan [Japanese] National Railways (JNR) was privatized on April 1, 1987, it became a station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
April 1, 1987: When Japan National Railways (JNR) was privatized, it became a station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
sen.cmt: [Japanese]を削除しました。日付表記変更

sen.j: 1989年3月5日 - 嵯峨駅（現在の嵯峨嵐山駅）～馬堀駅間が新線に切り替えられ複線されるとともに保津峡駅が移転し、廃駅となる。
sen.e: On March 5, 1989, a new double-track line was introduced between Saga Station (current Saga Arashiyama Station) and Umahori Station and Hozukyo Station also changed its location, making the operation of the station stopped.

On March 5, 1989, a new double-track line was introduced between Saga Station (the current Saga Arashiyama Station) and Umahori Station; moreover, Hozukyo Station changed its location, putting a halt to the operation of the station.

March 5, 1989: A new double-track line was introduced between Saga Station (the current Saga Arashiyama Station) and Umahori Station; moreover, Hozukyo Station changed its location, putting a halt to the operation of the station.

sen.j: 1991年4月27日 トロッコ保津峡駅として再開業。
sen.e: On April 27, 1991, its operation was restarted with the name of Hozukyo Torokko Station.
On April 27, 1991, its operation was restarted under the name of Hozukyo Torokko Station.
April 27, 1991: Its operation was restarted under the name of Hozukyo Torokko Station.

sen.j: 鷺沢萠の小説「岸辺の駅」の舞台となった駅である。
sen.e: Stories in "Kishibe-no- Eki (A station on a shore-side)," a novel by Megumu SAGISAWA, are centered on this station.
The stories in "Kishibe-no- Eki (A station on a shore-side)," a novel by Megumu SAGISAWA, are centered on this station.
The stories in 'Kishibe-no- Eki' (A station on a shore-side), a novel by Megumu SAGISAWA, are centered on this station.

sen.j: トロッコ嵐山駅 - トロッコ保津峡駅 - トロッコ亀岡駅
sen.e: Arashiyama Torokko Station - Hozukyo Torokko Station - Kameoka Torokko Station
